Enterprise AI Implementation & ROI.snippet:
AI agents are no longer experimental—they’re operational. But for many executive leaders, the results have been underwhelming. According to the 2025 IBM Institute for Business Values C-suite Study, only 25% of AI initiatives have delivered the expected return on investment (ROI), and just 16% have scaled enterprise-wide. These numbers reveal a critical gap between ambition and execution. [...] # From hype to high-impact: How business leaders can realize ROI with AI agents

AI agents, capable of orchestrating complex workflows to support human workers, help enterprises meet escalating business demands. AI Market Trends & Implementation Challe.title: From pilot to profit: The real path to scalable, ROI-positive AI
AI Market Trends & Implementation Challe.snippet: The statistics are sobering. Industry research shows that 85% of AI projects never make it to production, and of those that do, fewer than half generate meaningful business value. The problem isn't technical—it's organizational. Companies treat AI as a science experiment rather than a business capability. [...] The failure patterns are predictable: scattered initiatives across business units, unclear success metrics, insufficient data infrastructure and—most critically—the absence of governance

AI Market Trends & Implementation Challe.title: Employees attribute AI project failure to poor data quality
AI Market Trends & Implementation Challe.snippet:
The findings agree with other surveys showing that, despite enthusiasm around AI, enterprises struggle to deploy AI-powered products. Business use of AI grew a whopping 270% over the past four years, according to Gartner, while Deloitte says 62% of respondents to its corporate October 2018 report adopted some form of AI, up from 53% in 2019. But adoption doesn't always meet with success, as the roughly 25% of companies that have seen half their AI projects fail will tell you. [...] All Posts
